title: The Circle's Paddy and Tim planning travel spin-off show and we're already keen
text:
Paddy Smyth won The Circle 2019 (Picture: Channel 4)

Paddy Smyth won The Circle in a tense final last night, leaving viewers shocked.

Despite the competition only ending yesterday, the 31-year-old has already got a spin-off show in mind, alongside Tim Wilson.

In fact, although they were rivals in the Circle, the pair are hoping to front their own travel series on Channel 4.

And we need this to happen, so much.

Speaking about the potential project, the winner explained: ‘We’re both thinking of doing a travel show where we travel around Ireland together to all the different counties in pink suits.

‘I’m going to bring him over to my neck of the woods.’

Could you imagine a Paddy and Tim spin-off show? (Picture: PA)

And in true Tim form, he’s most excited by the outfits they might be donning along the way.

‘I’m most looking forward to the pink suits,’ he added to the Sun.

Never change, Tim.

Paddy beat the monk, Georgina, Woody and ‘Sammie’ – aka James – to the £70,000 prize, with his new best friend taking home a further £30,000 after a public vote.

Paddy isn’t too fussed about Circle backlash (Picture: PA)

However, his win was marred slightly by some viewers claiming he wasn’t a ‘worthy winner’.

But Paddy isn’t too fussed about the backlash, and nor should he be.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, he told us: ‘I mean, Beyonce divides opinion, so if she can do it I can do it! You know what I mean?

‘If they’re talking about me, that’s good enough!

‘I know that in some ways I’ve divided opinion, but at least I went in there and I was myself.

‘I hope that I’ve given a voice maybe to that disabled child that doesn’t think they’re going to be somebody or their parents that think that their disabled child isn’t going to have a normal life.’
